messages: 1411ae06b17bb8fefe8e04d75acc5133 (09:11): if you are a brave soul you can get the new rev of OpenSSH at http://www.blastwave.org/testing/index.html
1411ae06b17bb8fefe8e04d75acc5133 (09:11): anyone know where I can get OpenGL for Solaris x86 ?
6fb06278f0acad5116524cf789d291c2 (09:12): if you have S10 03/05 you have to get the nVIDIA drivers then build Mesa on your own
6fb06278f0acad5116524cf789d291c2 (09:12): if you have S10U2 it comes with
1411ae06b17bb8fefe8e04d75acc5133 (09:12): I have S10U2 and snv_38 here
6fb06278f0acad5116524cf789d291c2 (09:13): just install the latest nVIDIA drivers and they have OpenGL
d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (09:13): Hey, anyone else having trouble getting to http://www.openzoep.org/ ? It's been broken for 2 days here
6fb06278f0acad5116524cf789d291c2 (09:13): unless you want to build it yourself from source
1411ae06b17bb8fefe8e04d75acc5133 (09:14): well .. I am certain that I can get OpenGL for Solaris 8 on Sparc only
6fb06278f0acad5116524cf789d291c2 (09:15): and on Sparc you're better off with a good graphics card for S8 like Elite 3DM6
1411ae06b17bb8fefe8e04d75acc5133 (09:17): there you see that I have GLX and SGI-GLX extensions
6fb06278f0acad5116524cf789d291c2 (09:17): that's standard in Mesa and in Sun OpenGL
1411ae06b17bb8fefe8e04d75acc5133 (09:18): SunOS titan 5.8 Generic_117351-39 i86pc i386 i86pc
6fb06278f0acad5116524cf789d291c2 (09:18): so you built Mesa on S8
1411ae06b17bb8fefe8e04d75acc5133 (09:18): what I have here is a bit of a hack
1411ae06b17bb8fefe8e04d75acc5133 (09:18): actually I am sitting in front of a dual Opteron S10U2 machine
1411ae06b17bb8fefe8e04d75acc5133 (09:19): and logged into a S8 x86 machine remotely
1411ae06b17bb8fefe8e04d75acc5133 (09:19): the screen thus supports the GLX extensions
6fb06278f0acad5116524cf789d291c2 (09:19): you mean Xorg on your S10U2 supports it
1411ae06b17bb8fefe8e04d75acc5133 (09:19): then I ssh over to my snv_38 machine and export the display
1411ae06b17bb8fefe8e04d75acc5133 (09:20): if I hit the CTRL+ALT and + keys I wil lsee
1411ae06b17bb8fefe8e04d75acc5133 (09:20): I better keep hitting CTRL ALT +
1411ae06b17bb8fefe8e04d75acc5133 (09:24): geez .. where the heck is glxgears
1411ae06b17bb8fefe8e04d75acc5133 (09:24): I think I better focus on the task at hand
1411ae06b17bb8fefe8e04d75acc5133 (09:25): getting my new S10u2 box patched
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (09:37): which is not /usr/X/demo, which is /usr/openwin demo.
b714159ea02e81151caf5d2dbf252299 (09:54): Hi, where could I find (or how could I compile) a specific library file i'm missing: libintl.so.2 (for sparc) ... anyone has it ?
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (09:55): libintl.so.2 is probably from GNU gettext.
b714159ea02e81151caf5d2dbf252299 (09:55): it's just that I'm on a computer where I can't just add and remove packages, I haven no root
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (09:55): but there's also the Sun libintl (which is libintl.so.1 on here)
1411ae06b17bb8fefe8e04d75acc5133 (09:56): what rev of Solaris you on ?  what arch ?
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (09:56): I believe Sun's libintl is just a filter, so you almost certainly want the one from gettext.
b714159ea02e81151caf5d2dbf252299 (09:57): I found something at the opensolaris site: http://ln-s.net/CcA but it's empty
1411ae06b17bb8fefe8e04d75acc5133 (09:57): just go download the package from a Blastwave mirror
1411ae06b17bb8fefe8e04d75acc5133 (09:58): then pkgadd it into your home directory under some test point
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (09:58): or break it apart with pkgtrans, if you're feeling brave.
1411ae06b17bb8fefe8e04d75acc5133 (09:58): or .. yeah .. break it open and get what you want
1411ae06b17bb8fefe8e04d75acc5133 (09:59): if you have something to calm your nerves
1411ae06b17bb8fefe8e04d75acc5133 (09:59): okay .. I now have to patch this box
1411ae06b17bb8fefe8e04d75acc5133 (10:03): you may need to set LD_LIBRARY_PATH
1411ae06b17bb8fefe8e04d75acc5133 (10:04): now if I had $8K to spend
